allowDtSTSDominate: allowDtSTSDominate allow a situation in which dt_STS becomes larger than dt_Hydro (dt_advection) (assuming that diffusion dt is smaller than advection dt) upto advection one, but not faster than the advection advancement. This will be useful in solving PDE systems that are hyperbolic + parabolic. FALSE will use the STS algorithm to even accelerate advection time advancement, which in turn, will use larger advection dt than advection dt from CFL limits. This will be useful in solving only hyperbolic PDE systems in general. When hyperbolic + parabolic PDE system is to be solved, then we suggest that users use less agressive super time stepping method by using useSTSforDiffusion = TRUE.
dr_abortPause: When Driver_abortFlash is called to abnormally end execution, and dr_abortPause is grater than zero, the FLASH Driver_abortFlash code will sleep for dr_abortPause seconds after writing explanatory messages (to standard output and, possibly, to log files) but before calling MPI_ABORT. See also eachProcWritesOwnAbortLog for controlling the generation of per-processor log files.
dr_dtMinBelowAction: Action to take when computed new timestep is below dr_dtMinContinue. Use 0 for none (abort immediately), 1 for "write checkpoint then abort"
dr_dtMinContinue: Minimum computed timestep to continue the simulation
dr_numPosdefVars: number of variables for positive-definite time step limiter
dr_posdefDtFactor: Valid Values: Scaling factor for dt limit from positive-definite time step limiter. Similar to CFL factor. If set to -1, use CFL factor from Hydro.
dr_shortenLastStepBeforeTMax: If TRUE, make the dt for the last time step shorter if necassary so as to avoid overshooting tmax.
dr_tstepSlowStartFactor: The initial dt is set to be at most the timestep computed by CFL conditions applied to certain operators multiplied with this factor.
dr_usePosdefComputeDt: turns positive-definite time step limiter on.
drift_trunc_mantissa: number of mantissa bits to exclude from hash (3 bits ~ 1 sigdig)
drift_tuples: should block data be written in python tuples format
eachProcWritesOwnAbortLog: Should each process writes messages to its own log file when Driver_abortFlash gets called to abnormally end execution? If true, each process in which Driver_abortFlash is called will attempt to write an explanatory message to its own log file, whether that file already existed or needs to be newly created.  If false, the Driver_abortFlash message will appear only in the regular log file (if the Logfile code unit is used), and normally only when Driver_abortFlash is called by the process with PE 0.
iProcs: number of procs in the i dir
jProcs: number of procs in the j dir
kProcs: number of procs in the k dir
meshCopyCount: The number of copies of full computational mesh that
nend: Maximum number of timesteps to take
nuSTS: nu stability parameter for super time stepping algorithm
sweepOrder: Determine the order of the directional sweeps
tstep_change_factor: The initial time step dt is multiplied with this factor at every timestep, until it is limited by CFL condition, allowing users to specify a very conservative initial dt and letting it grow by specifying a tstep_change_factor > 1.0.
useSTS: Do we want to use super time stepping (STS) algorithm?
useSTSforDiffusion: TRUE will use the STS algorithm to accelerate diffusion time advancement
wall_clock_time_limit: Valid Values: Total wall clock time limit (seconds). Use -1.0 for no limit.
zFinal: The final redshift in a simulation.  The simulation will stop
zInitial: The initial redshift in a simulation.  < 0 if not being used.

bndPriorityOne: indicates which direction (IAXIS, JAXIS, or KAXIS) gets top priority when applying boundary conditions in corner guardcells We define three values for edges left, center, right, of which center represents interior, while left and right represent the corresponding guardcells. We define a corner where more than one dimension has its its guardcells, so the application must determine which direction gets to fill them. In 2-D, there are four corners: (left,left), (left,right), (right,left) and (right,right). In 3-D case, the following corners are possible : (left,left,left),(left,left,center), (left,left,right),(left,center,left), (left,center,right),(left,right,left), (left,right,center),(left,right,right) (center,left,left),(center,left,right), (center,right,left),(center,right,right), (right,left,left),(right,left,center), (right,left,right),(right,center,left), (right,center,right),(right,right,left), (right,right,center),(right,right,right)
bndPriorityThree: the least priority dimension in applying boundary conditions
bndPriorityTwo: the second priority dimension in applying boundary conditions
convertToConsvdForMeshCalls: indicates if appropriate variables are converted from primitive to conserved form during propagation before control is passed to Paramesh for refinement, derefinement, or guardcell filling.  This is the old way of ensuring that solution variables are in the correct form for interpolation. It involves unnecessary conversions back and forth and should be obsoleted by the newer mechanism enabled by runtime parameter "convertToConsvdInMeshInterp".  The name is a replacement for the old "conserved_var" which many people have found to be very confusing terminology.
eosMode: eosMode determines how to operate on thermodynamic quantities. Possible values are "dens_ie", where density and internal energy are supplied and pressure and temperature are returned; "dens_pres", where density and pressure are given and energy and temperature are computed;  and "dens_temp", where density and temperature are given and pressure and energy are computed. Other values may also be available as, depending on whether a multiTemp Eos is used and on implementation of additional physics. For 3T simulations, the best choice is "dens_ie_recal_gather", since this mode will ensure that total energy is conserved when refinement changes occur.
eosModeInit: eosModeInit determines how to operate on thermodynamic quantities for the initial conditions.  A call to Simulation_initBlock sets initial conditions on each block, and an eos call follows which ensures the initial values are thermodynamically consistent.  The value of eosModeInit determines the mode in which these eos calls operate.  Possible values are "dens_ie", where density and internal energy are supplied and pressure and temperature are returned; "dens_pres", where density and pressure are given and energy and temperature are computed; and "dens_temp", where density and temperature are given and pressure and energy are computed.  Other values may also be available as, depending on whether a multiTemp Eos is used and on implementation of additional physics.
geometryOverride: whether to bypass some geometry sanity checks - use at your own risk.
gr_bcEnableApplyMixedGds: whether to enable the Grid_bcApplyToRegionMixedGds interface for implementing boundary conditions with access to the variables of mixed GDSs (in particlular, cell-centered UNK varsiables and face variables). This only has an effect if the GridBoundaryConditions subunit is included and the simulation actually supplies an implementation of Grid_bcApplyToRegionMixedGds.
unbiased_geometry: attempt to remove floating point bias from geometry discretization. Not implemented in FLASH3.
xl_boundary_type: xl_boundary_type lower (left) boundary condition in x dir
xmax: xmax physical domain upper bound in x dir
xmin: xmin physical domain lower bound in x dir
xr_boundary_type: xr_boundary_type upper (right) boundary condition in x dir
yl_boundary_type: yl_boundary_type lower boundary condition in y dir
ymax: ymax physical domain upper bound in y dir
ymin: ymin physical domain lower bound in y dir
yr_boundary_type: yr_boundary_type upper boundary condition in y dir
zl_boundary_type: zl_boundary_type lower boundary condition in z dir
zmax: zmax physical domain lower bound in x dir
zmin: zmin physical domain lower bound in z dir
zr_boundary_type: zr_boundary_type upper boundary condition in z dir

convertToConsvdInMeshInterp: indicates if appropriate variables are converted to conserved form during propagation within the interpolation routines invoked by Paramesh. This applies to interpolation (both "prolongation" and "restriction") in the course of refinement, derefinement, or guardcell filling. This is the newer way of ensuring that solution variables are interpolated in the correct form. It avoids unnecessary conversions back and force and should replace the old mechanism enabled by runtime parameter "convertToConsvdForMeshCalls". However, it is only available with PARAMESH 3 or later.
derefine_cutoff_1: derefine_cutoff_1 threshold value to trigger derefinement for refine_var_1
derefine_cutoff_2: derefine_cutoff_2 threshold value to trigger derefinement for refine_var_2
derefine_cutoff_3: derefine_cutoff_3 threshold value to trigger derefinement for refine_var_3
derefine_cutoff_4: derefine_cutoff_4 threshold value to trigger derefinement for refine_var_4
earlyBlockDistAdjustment: If true, let Paramesh redistribute blocks across processors early, so that the block distribution chosen by Paramesh will be in effect when time evolution begins after restart. If earlyBlockDistAdjustment is false, the block distribution enacted by the IO unit when it read a checkpoint file will normally still be in effect when time evolution begins after a restart. This flag is ignored if not restarting from a checkpoint.
flux_correct: turns on or off flux correction
gr_lrefineMaxByTime: This parameter activates the ability to manually specify values for lrefine_max as a function of time. You can change the value of lrefine_max a total of 20 times. The parameters gr_lrefmaxTime_N (where N is a number from 1 to 20) tell FLASH the times at which lrefine_max changes will occur. The analogous parameters gr_lrefmaxTimeValue_N (where N is a number from 1 to 20) tell FLASH  the value of lrefine_max to use at time gr_lrefmaxTime_N. For example, specifying the following lines in your flash.par file tells FLASH to use an lrefine_max value of 10 at t = 1.0e-09 s and a value of 11 at t = 2.0e-09 s:  gr_lrefmaxTime_1 = 1.0e-09 gr_lrefmaxTimeValue_1 = 10 gr_lrefmaxTime_2 = 2.0e-09 gr_lrefmaxTimeValue_2 = 10 . NOTE: the time values must be in sequential order!
gr_lrefineMaxRedDoByLogR: Softly force effectively a lower lrefine_max depending on distance from center. See gr_lrefineMaxRedRadiusFact.
gr_lrefineMaxRedDoByTime: Lower the effective lrefine_max as a function of time. See runtime parameters gr_lrefineMaxRedTRef, gr_lrefineMaxRedTimeScale, and gr_lrefineMaxRedLogBase.
gr_lrefineMaxRedLogBase: Logarithm base for determining when repeated reductions in effective lrefine_max should happen. The nth reduction will happen at t=gr_lrefineMaxRedTRef+gr_lrefineMaxRedTimeScale*gr_lrefineMaxRedLogBase**(n-1).
gr_lrefineMaxRedRadiusFact: factor that determines a minimum resolution (and thus maximum refinement level) based on distance from a center. See x_refine_center, y_refine_center, z_refine_center for the center coordinates.  This is approximately (linearly) equivalent to requiring a minimum *angular* resolution, within the limits set by the global lrefine_min and lrefine_max.  Only used when gr_lrefineMaxRedDoByLogR is TRUE.
gr_lrefineMaxRedTRef: reference time for time-based max level reduction. The effective reduction of lrefine_max only kicks in for times greater than gr_lrefineMaxRedTRef. The first time lrefine_max is effectively lowered actually happens at t=gr_lrefineMaxRedTRef+gr_lrefineMaxRedTimeScale.
gr_lrefineMaxRedTimeScale: the time scale for effectively lowering lrefine_max: The first reduction takes place at t=gr_lrefineMaxRedTRef+gr_lrefineMaxRedTimeScale.
gr_restrictAllMethod: select a method to use for data restriction all the way up the tree of blocks.  This this global data restriction is usually done when IO_output is called, before the actual writing of plot or checkpoint data, so that non-leaf blocks in plot and checkpoint files will have meaningful data. Data restrictions that happen as part of guard cell filling or within multigrid solvers are not affected by this setting. For PARAMESH 2, this runtime parameter is currently ignored. With PARAMESH 4, the following values are recognized:  0: No restriction is done. 1: The original method, implemented in gr_restrictTree. 2: New method, implemented using mpi_amr_restrict_fulltree. 3: New method, implemented using Grid_restrictByLevels.
interpol_order: the default interpolation order when using "monotonic" interpolation routines
lrefine_del: Try to reduce the maximum refinement level by this number of levels on a restart.
lrefine_min_init: minimum AMR refinement level for initialization
max_particles_per_blk: integer  if the number of particles in a block exceeds this, it must refine  when particle count is a refinement criterion
min_particles_per_blk: integer  if the number of particles in a block is below this, it may derefine when particle count is a refinement criterion
nblockx: nblockx num initial blocks in x dir
nblocky: nblocky num initial blocks in y dir
nblockz: nblockz num initial blocks in z dir
nrefs: refine/derefine AMR grid every nrefs timesteps
refine_cutoff_1: refine_cutoff_1 threshold value to trigger refinement for refine_var_1
refine_cutoff_2: refine_cutoff_2 threshold value to trigger refinement for refine_var_2
refine_cutoff_3: refine_cutoff_3 threshold value to trigger refinement for refine_var_3
refine_cutoff_4: refine_cutoff_4 threshold value to trigger refinement for refine_var_4
refine_filter_1: prevents error calculations to determine refinement from diverging numerically for refine_var_1
refine_filter_2: prevents error calculations to determine refinement from diverging numerically for refine_var_1
refine_filter_3: prevents error calculations to determine refinement from diverging numerically for refine_var_3
refine_filter_4: prevents error calculations to determine refinement from diverging numerically for refine_var_4
refine_on_particle_count: if true, the count of particles in blocks act as a refinement criterion
refine_var_1: refine_var_1 indicates 1st variable on which to refine
refine_var_2: refine_var_2 indicates 2nd variable on which to refine
refine_var_3: refine_var_3 indicates 3rd variable on which to refine
refine_var_4: refine_var_4 indicates 4th variable on which to refine
refine_var_count: refine_var_count count of maximum allowed variable to be used
x_refine_center: First coordinate of center for distance-based refinement patterns
y_refine_center: Second coordinate of center for distance-based refinement patterns
z_refine_center: Third coordinate of center for distance-based refinement patterns

enableMaskedGCFill: When enableMaskedGCFill is FALSE, Grid_fillGuardCells is forced to always ignore optional mask arguments when present in calls. This is the default behavior. Set enableMaskedGCFill TRUE to enable masked guard cell filling.
gr_sanitizeDataMode: What to do when gr_sanitizeDataAfterInterp is called to check for acceptable values in the dens, ener, and eint cell-centered variables after a Grid operation may have resulted in grid interpolation. 0: Do nothing. 1: Check (if variable is not masked out) and report (see sanitizeVerbosity). 2: Check (ignoring variable mask) and report (see sanitizeVerbosity). 3: Check (if variable is not masked out) and fix (apply floor value). 4: Check (if variable is not masked out) and abort if cell is found below floor value.
gr_sanitizeVerbosity: How to write information about unacceptable values in the dens, ener, and eint cell-centered variables if gr_sanitizeDataAfterInterp finds value that are below the acceptable floor. This reporting is in addition to other actions selected with gr_sanitizeDataMode=3 or 4. 0: Be quiet. 1: Only write a log file message per block if unacceptable value found on MASTER_PE. 4: As 1, and each proc writes a line to standard output for each block with bad values. 5: As 4, and each proc writes lines showing the values in all cells of the block (in 1D/2D) or a 2D slice (in 3D).

gr_pmrpAdvanceAllLevels: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter advance_all_levels
gr_pmrpAmrErrorChecking: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter amr_error_checking
gr_pmrpCartesianPm: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter cartesian_pm This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpConserve: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter conserve
gr_pmrpConsvFluxDensities: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter consv_flux_densities This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpConsvFluxes: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter consv_fluxes This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpCurvilinear: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter curvilinear. This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpCurvilinearConserve: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter curvilinear_conserve. This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much. However, if you manually set gr_pmrpCurvilinear to TRUE, you probably should also set gr_pmrpCurvilinearConserve TRUE.
gr_pmrpCylindricalPm: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter cylindrical_pm This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpDiagonals: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter diagonals
gr_pmrpDivergenceFree: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter divergence_free. 0 means FALSE, 1 means TRUE. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up; currently that means to check whether a preprocessor symbol DIVERGENCE_FREE is defined.
gr_pmrpEdgeValue: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter edge_value This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpEdgeValueInteg: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter edge_value_integ This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpEmptyCells: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter empty_cells
gr_pmrpForceConsistency: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter force_consistency
gr_pmrpIfaceOff: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter iface_off
gr_pmrpL2p5d: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter l2p5d. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpLsingularLine: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter lsingular_line
gr_pmrpMaxblocks: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter maxblocks. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpMflags: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter mflags
gr_pmrpNboundaries: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nboundaries
gr_pmrpNdim: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter ndim.
gr_pmrpNedgevar1: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nedgevar1. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpNfacevar: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nfacevar
gr_pmrpNfieldDivf: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nfield_divf. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpNfluxvar: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nfluxvar. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpNguard: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nguard. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpNguardWork: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nguard_work. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpNoPermanentGuardcells: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter no_permanent_guardcells
gr_pmrpNvar: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nvar. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpNvarWork: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nvar_work
gr_pmrpNvarcorn: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nvarcorn
gr_pmrpNvaredge: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nvaredge
gr_pmrpNxb: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nxb. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpNyb: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nyb. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpNzb: Valid Values: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter nzb. -1 means: let FLASH determine the value based on how it has been set up.
gr_pmrpPolarPm: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter polar_pm This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpPredCorr: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter pred_corr
gr_pmrpSphericalPm: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter spherical_pm This will be adjusted by FLASH at runtime if necessary, so don't worry much.
gr_pmrpTimingMpi: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter timing_mpi
gr_pmrpTimingMpix: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter timing_mpix
gr_pmrpVarDt: sets value for PARAMESH runtime parameter var_dt

gr_ptMaxPerProcBlockFactor: When the effective max_particles_per_blk is lowered on a processor because refinement criteria based on the number of particles PER PROCESSOR are used, then the new effective max_particles_per_blk is set to (gr_ptMaxPerProcBlockFactor * pt_maxPerProc). In addition, when the effective min_particles_per_blk is lowered on a processor because refinement criteria based on the number of particles PER PROCESSOR are used, then the new effective min_particles_per_blk is set to (0.5^NDIM * gr_ptMaxPerProcBlockFactor * pt_maxPerProc).
gr_ptMaxPerProcBlockNoFuzz: A safety margin for estimating the size of basically unpredictable changes of the number of blocks on a processor when remeshing happens.
gr_ptMaxPerProcLowerThresh: A threshold. When the number of particles on a processor gets above (ptMaxPerProcLowerThresh * number of blocks on the processor), the effective min_particles_per_blk for blocks on this processor may be lowered.
gr_ptMaxPerProcUpperThresh: A threshold. When the number of particles on a processor gets above (ptMaxPerProcUpperThresh * number of blocks on the processor), the effective max_particles_per_blk for blocks on this processor may be lowered.
gr_ptNumToReduce: integer  if particles are to be removed at runtime, how many
gr_ptRefineOnPtMaxPerProc: controls whether refinement criteria based on the number of particles PER PROCESSOR are used. These work by strengthening refinement criteria requested through the max_particles_per_blk and min_particles_per_blk RPs.  Requires RP refine_on_particle_count to be TRUE.
gr_ptRemove: boolean.  This is a switch which determines the action if the number
gr_ptRemoveAlgo: integer  The algorithm used in determining which particles to remove
gr_ptSieveCheckFreq: integer the frequency for checking the convergence of the

gr_hypreAbsTol: If > 0.0, directly sets a_tol (absolute tolerance) for the HYPRE iterative solver. Convergence criteria:  <C*r,r>  <= max( a_tol^2, r_tol^2 * <C*b,b> ). Note: default for a_tol is 0.0, so relative residual criteria is used unless user specifies a_tol, or sets r_tol = 0.0, which means absolute tol only is checked. See also gr_hypreSolverAutoAbsTolFact, for another way of setting a_tol. Currently only used when gr_hypreSolverType is "HYPRE_PCG".
gr_hypreCfTol: If > 0.0, enable in the iterative HYPRE solver an pptional test to see if adequate progress is being made. The average convergence factor is recorded and compared against the tolerance 'cf_tol'. The weighting factor is intended to pay more attention to the test when an accurate estimate for average convergence factor is available. Currently only used when gr_hypreSolverType is "HYPRE_PCG". Example suggested values: something like 0.5, 0.8, 0.9, 0.95, 0.99.
gr_hypreFloor: floor value for using HYPRE to advance diffusion.
gr_hypreInfoLevel: : Flag to output solver specific information such as Relative Residue, num-iterations.
gr_hyprePrintSolveInfo: : Flag to output solver specific information such as Relative Residue, num-iterations.
gr_hypreRecomputeResidual: If TRUE, don't trust the convergence test until we've recomputed the residual from scratch.  This is expensive in the usual case where an the norm is the energy norm. This calculation is coded on the assumption that the accuracy of the residual r is only a concern for problems where CG takes many iterations. Currently only used when gr_hypreSolverType is "HYPRE_PCG".
gr_hypreRecomputeResidualP: If > 0, recompute the residual every gr_hypreRecomputeResidualP iterations. Currently only used when gr_hypreSolverType is "HYPRE_PCG".
gr_hypreRelChange: At user request, don't treat an approximation of the solution x in the HYPRE iterative solver  as converged unless x didn't change much in the last iteration. Currently only used when gr_hypreSolverType is "HYPRE_PCG".
gr_hypreRelTol: Relative tolerence r_tol of HYPRE linear solver.
gr_hypreSolverAutoAbsTolFact: If not 0.0, automatically set a_tol (absolute tolerance) for the HYPRE iterative solver. If also gr_hypreAbsTol > 0, then the maximum of gr_hypreAbsTol and the automatically determined value is taken. See description of gr_hypreAbsTol for the use if a_tool in the HYPRE solver. If gr_hypreSolverAutoAbsTolFact > 0, then set f = gr_hypreSolverAutoAbsTolFact. If gr_hypreSolverAutoAbsTolFact < 0, then set f = |gr_hypreSolverAutoAbsTolFact|*gr_hypreRelTol. In either case, the automatically determined value for a_tol is f*sqrt(<Cest*bfloor,bfloor>). Here <Cest*bfloor,bfloor> is a rough estimate of the smallest possible value of the inverse of the diagonal part of the matrix C representing the preconditioner. In that estimate, bfloor is a vector that represents a worst-case tolerable error in b (the RHS of the equation to be solved, A*x=b). Currently, bfloor is set to a vector whose every element is set to gr_hypreFloor. If gr_hypreAbsTol > 0 in addition to gr_hypreSolverAutoAbsTolFact .ne. 0.0, then the maximum of gr_hypreAbsTol and the automatically determined value is taken. Currently only used when gr_hypreSolverType is "HYPRE_PCG".
gr_hypreSolverType: : Type of HYPRE solver to be used.
gr_hypreUse2Norm: whether to use L2 norm for exit condition in iterative solver (instead of L1 norm). Currently only used when gr_hypreSolverType is "HYPRE_PCG".
gr_hypreUseFloor: whether to apply gr_hypreFloor to floor results from HYPRE. Should probably be TRUE when using HYPRE to advance diffusion, FALSE otherwise. However, flooring will always be turned off when using the HYPRE implementation of Grid_solvePoisson, independent of the value of the gr_hypreUseFloor runtime parameter.

alwaysComputeUserVars: Allows the user to force the computation of user variables (i.e. those computed by Grid_computeUserVars) for all checkpoint files.  Defaults to true.  If set to false, lone calls to IO_writeCheckpoint will not call Grid_computeUserVars.  Plotfiles always call Grid_computeUserVars.
alwaysRestrictCheckpoint: Allows the user to choose whether checkpoint file data is always restricted, so all ancestor blocks have valid data. The default is true. It can be set to false for debugging purposes, in which case only the data from IO_output will be guaranteed to have fully restricted data.  See the User's guide for more information.
checkpointFileNumber: Initial checkpoint file number (used for restarts as well)
chkGuardCellsInput: if true guardcells are read from the checkpoint file. Default is false where only interior cells are read. Currently only implemented with hdf5 parallel paramesh IO implementation
chkGuardCellsOutput: if true guardcells are written the checkpoint file. Default is false where only interior cells are written. Currently only implemented with hdf5 parallel paramesh IO implementation
corners: does nothing.  However, it is part of the checkpoint file specification, so we retain the checkpoint entry, but force it to be .false.. It was used in FLASH2 to interpolate the data to the zone corners before storing the data in the plotfile (for creating improved iso-surfaces).
fileFormatVersion: Integer value specifying the file format type
io_writeMscalarIntegrals: Should density integrals for all mass scalars be written to the stats_file (.dat file)?  This runtime parameter is handled in the default IO_writeIntegralQuantities implementation in IOMain, and may have no effect if a simulation overrides that implementation.
memory_stat_freq: Specify the number of timesteps between memory statistic dumps to flash.log !!NOT Yet Implemented in F3
outputSplitNum: Split checkpoint, plotfiles, particle plots into this many files per dump Not fully implemented, only hdf5 parallel. use at own risk
output_directory: output dir for checkpoint file, can be absolute or relative path
plotFileIntervalStep: Write a plotfile after this many steps
plotFileIntervalTime: plotFileIntervalTime Write a plotfile after this much time
plotFileIntervalZ: Write a plotfile after this change in z
plot_grid_var_1: Allows user to output specific scratch grid vars Up to 12 choices are allowed.  If plot_grid_var_X is set to "none" then no variable will be saved. The parameter should have the same name as the variable corresponding to it. For exampe, if a variable is declared GRID_VAR vrtz, to write that grid variable to a plotfile a parameter should be declared as PARAMETER plot_grid_var_X STRING "vrtz"
plotfileGridQuantityDP: If true, this sets the grid variables (unk, facevars, etc.) to be output in double precision in plotfiles. Default value is false.
plotfileMetadataDP: Sets the floating point grid metadata fields to be written in double precision if true in plotfiles.  Default value is false
rolling_checkpoint: Checkpoint file number cycling span. Only the last rolling_checkpoint files are kept.
rss_limit: Maximum value (in MB) of largest resident set size (rss) before we checkpoint and exit. Negative for no limit.  Only active if memory statistics are being kept.
stats_file: Name of the file integral quantities are written to (.dat file)
summaryOutputOnly: Makes FLASH write integrated quantities, i.e. summary data, only. FLASH will only write a checkpoint, plot, or particle file if the user creates a .dump_plotfile, .dump_checkpoint, .dump_restart, or .dump_particle_file file.  A .kill file will still kill FLASH.
typeMatchedXfer: Ensures that floating point data transfers are type matched when using HDF5.  This prevents HDF5 reverting to independent parallel I/O.
useCollectiveHDF5: If true, all non-header, non-list datasets will be written using HDF5's collective output mode otherwise, the independent access mode is used.  Default value is true.
useLegacyLabels: If true, this stores mesh labels e.g. 'dens', 'pres' in a IO library dataspace of 4 characters.  We may want to set it to false to use larger labels e.g. 'density'
wall_clock_checkpoint: Checkpoint after XX seconds (wallclock time) This is useful to ensure that the job outputs a restart file before a queue window closes.
wr_integrals_freq: Number of timesteps between writing to flash.dat

packMeshPlotWriteHDF5: If true, this specifies that we pack the

eos_fillEosType: Fill EOS type to use for MTMMMT EOS
eos_fillSubType: Fill EOS subtype to use for MTMMMT EOS
eos_wallEosType: Wall EOS type to use for MTMMMT EOS
eos_wallSubType: Wall EOS subtype to use for MTMMMT EOS
ms_fillA: Fill Number of protons and neutrons in nucleus
ms_wallA: Wall Number of protons and neutrons in nucleus

useParticles: Whether to advance particles [TRUE] or not [FALSE]

pc_unitsBase: Base Unit system for Physical Constants -- can be "CGS" or "MKS"

sim_condWall: Wall conductivity at the gas/wall interface
sim_peakField: Peak field in gauss at capillary wall

useProtonEmission: flag indicating whether to use the ProtonEmission unit

useProtonImaging: flag indicating whether to use the ProtonImaging unit

useThomsonScattering: flag indicating whether to use the ThomsonScattering unit

log_file: Name of log file to create

eachProcWritesSummary: Should each process write its summary to its own file?  If true, each process will write its summary to a file named timer_summary_<processor id>
writeStatSummary: Should timers write the max/min/avg values for timers?

useCosmology: whether to use the Cosmology implementation or not

diff_anisoCondForEle: flags whether to use anisotropic heat conductivition (for electrons or 1T)
diff_eleFlCoef: diff_eleFlCoef Electron conduction flux limiter coefficient
diff_scaleFactThermSaTempDiff: Factor applied to the temperature difference (or internal energy difference) that is computed by the standalone thermal Diffusion implementation.
diff_scaleFactThermSaTime: Factor applied to the time step for which the standalone thermal Diffusion implementation computes the temperature (or internal energy) increase or decrease.
diff_useCrossCond: flags whether to use cross term in anisotropic heat conduction
diffusion_cutoff_density: density below which we no longer diffuse
dt_diff_factor: dt_diff_factor factor that scales the timestep returned by Diffuse_computeDt
useDiffuse: useDiffuse whether any method of the Diffuse unit should contribute to fluxes
useDiffuseComputeDtSpecies: flags whether Diffuse_computeDt considers species mass diffusion
useDiffuseComputeDtTherm: flags whether Diffuse_computeDt considers thermal conduction
useDiffuseSpecies: whether Diffuse_species [TO BE IMPLEMENTED] should contribute to fluxes
useDiffuseTherm: whether Diffuse_therm should contribute to fluxes
useDiffuseVisc: whether Diffuse_visc should contribute to fluxes

eintSwitch: a rarely used switch which ensures that internal energy calculations maintain sufficient precision. Important only if energyTotal is dominated by energyKinetic. If (energyInternal < eintSwitch*energyKinetic) then some routines (Eos/Helmholtz, Hydro/hy_updateSoln) will NOT calculate energyInternal by subtraction, but rather through direct calculation.
eos_entrEleScaleChoice: selects a scale variant for representing electron entropy. See code in eos_idealGamma for the meaning of the various choices. The choice that corresponds most closely to the Sackur-Tetrode equation in physical units should be 3, closely followed by 2.
eos_logLevel: Control verbosity of messages from the Eos unit. See Eos.h for relevant EOS_LOGLEVEL_* definitions.

eint1Switch: OBSOLETE - a switch which tries to ensure that internal energy calculations for component 1 in a multiple-temperature setup maintain sufficient precision. Important only if total energy for this component is dominated by bulk kinetic energy. A value of -1 means to use the value of eintSwitch for eint1Switch.
eint2Switch: OBSOLETE - a switch which tries to ensure that internal energy calculations for component 2 in a multiple-temperature setup maintain sufficient precision. See eint1Switch. A value of -1 means to use the value of eintSwitch for eint2Switch.
eint3Switch: OBSOLETE - a switch which tries to ensure that internal energy calculations for component 3 in a multiple-temperature setup maintain sufficient precision. See eint1Switch. A value of -1 means to use the value of eintSwitch for eint3Switch.
eos_combinedTempRule: Valid Values: determines for multiTemp Eos implementations what a call to Eos will return in the EOS_TEMP part of eosData, when Eos is called in a mode for which EOS_TEMP is an output and different component temperatures can be returned. 1 for ion temperature EOS_TEMPION; 2 for electron temperature EOS_TEMPELE; 3 for radiation temperature EOS_TEMPRAD; 0 for the temperature that would result in the same specific internal energy as given if all components where equilibrated at the same temperature, which may be expensive to compute; -10 for undefined, i.e., we do not care what is returned. Currently only implemented for Multitype Eos.
eos_smallEele: a floor value used for the electron component of internal energy in the Eos unit
eos_smallEion: a floor value used for the ion component of internal energy by the Eos unit
eos_smallErad: a floor value used for the radiation component of internal energy in the Eos unit

eos_singleSpeciesA: Nucleon number for the gas (for Eos tracking matter as single species)
eos_singleSpeciesZ: Proton number for the gas (for Eos tracking matter as single species)
gamma: Ratio of specific heats for gas
gammaEle: Ratio of specific heats for electron component
gammaIon: Ratio of specific heats for ion component
gammaRad: Ratio of specific heats for radiation component

eos_forceConstantInput: Newton-Raphson loop in Eos can allow input EINT or PRES to change on output to preserve equilibrium.  This switch forces a constant input of EINT or PRES
eos_largeT: default upper bracket bound and used to fake temperature if it tries to go too high. Used in some Helmholtz and Multitype implementations of Eos.
eos_maxNewton: maximum number of Newton-Raphson iterations to try.

grav_boundary_type: grav_boundary_type Type of gravitational boundary condition if a Poisson solve is used for Gravity; string-valued version of grav_boundary. Accepts: "isolated", "periodic", "dirichlet", and maybe others, depending on the Poisson solver used. This is declared in the stub level of the Gravity unit to allow the Grid unit to refer to this runtime parameter even when no Gravity implementation is included.
useGravity: useGravity Whether gravity calculations should be performed.

updateHydroFluxes: updateHydroFluxes whether fluxes computed by Hydro should be used to update the solution (currently, probably only used in split PPM Hydro)
useHydro: useHydro Should any Hydro calculations be performed?
use_cma_advection: use_cma_advection Use the CMA advection with partial masses being primary variables; thos parameter only affects the unsplit PPM hydro solver.
use_cma_flattening: use_cma_flattening Use the flattening procedure for the abundances as described in the CMA paper; this parameter only affects the unsplit PPM hydro solver.

EOSforRiemann: Turn on/off calls to Eos for thermo of reconstructed face states (MODE_DENS_PRES)
LimitedSlopeBeta: LimitedSlopeBeta Any real value specific for the Limited Slope limiter
RiemannSolver: RiemannSolver Roe, HLL, HLLC, Marquina, MarquinaModified, Hybrid or local Lax-Friedrichs, plus HLLD for MHD
charLimiting: charLimiting Apply limiting for characteristic variable
conserveAngMom: Conservative formulation for cylindrical coordinates regarding the toroidal momentum
entropy: entropy Entropy Fix routine for the Roe Riemann solver
entropyFixMethod: Entropy fix method for the Roe Riemann solver: Harten or HartenHyman
hy_3Torder: Reconstruction order for eint, eele, eion, erad in HEDP simulations
hy_cflFallbackFactor: factor for scaling CFL factor when it is lowered because of fallback in problematic cells
hy_eosModeGc: Eos mode that the Hydro unit should apply to guard cells before the first major loop, i.e., before computing Riemann input states by reconstruction etc. The special value "see eosMode" can be used to indicate the mode set by the runtime parameter "eosMode". Other values are as for "eosMode".
hy_fPresInMomFlux: Percentage of the pressure gradient (values range from 0 to 1) that is treated as part of momentum fluxes
hy_fallbackLowerCFL: Lower the simulation CFL if fallin back to a lower reconstruction order in problematic cells
hy_fullSpecMsFluxHandling: Are species and mass scalars updated with fluxes that have undergone the full treatment applied to other fluxes, including fine-coarse-boundary flux correction if that is done to fluxes of other conserved variables?
hybridOrderKappa: A constant value to determine shock strengths for hybrid order
hydroComputeDtOption: An option where to compute hydro dt. Choices are integer values [-1, 0, 1] as follows: -1: Hydro_computeDt.F90,  the old standard way that has most extensive supports and well-tested; 0: hy_uhd_energyFix.F90, a light weighted version without calling a global loop Hydro_computeDt; 1: hy_getFaceFlux.F90,   another light weighted dt call during flux calculations.
order: order 1st order Godunov scheme, 2nd MUSCL-Hancock scheme, or 3rd PPM, 5th WENO
shockDetect: shockDetect Switch to use a strong compressive shock detection
shockLowerCFL: Lower the simulation CFL if shocks are detected
slopeLimiter: slopeLimiter mc, vanLeer, vanLeer1.5, minmod, hybrid, limited
tiny: A threshold value for an arbitrarily small number
transOrder: order of approximating transeverse flux derivative in data reconstruction
use_3dFullCTU: Turn on/off the full CTU scheme that gives CFL <= 1 for 3D
use_auxEintEqn: Turn on/off solving the auxilary internal energy equation
use_gravHalfUpdate: Include gravitational accelerations to hydro coupling at n+1/2
use_hybridOrder: Apply RH jump condition to check monotonicity of reconstructed values
use_steepening: Switch for steepening contact discontinuities for 3rd order PPM

E_modification: Switch for modified electric fields calculation from flux
E_upwind: Switch for upwind update for induction equations
ForceHydroLimit: Switch to force B=0 limit, i.e., the solver will not update B fields
conserveAngField: Turn on/off alternate formulation for toroidal induction
energyFix: Switch for an energy correction for CT scheme
hallVelocity: Switch to use u_ele = u - J/(ne qe)
hy_bier1TA: Atomic number to use for 1T Biermann Battery term
hy_bier1TZ: Ionization number to use for 1T Biermann Battery term
hy_biermannSource: Switch to implement battery term as an external source
killdivb8w: Switch for maintaing solenoidal field using Powell's 8wave
prolMethod: Injection or Balsara's method in prolongation
use_Biermann: Switch to add the Battery term for B-field generation
use_Biermann1T: Switch to add the 1T Battery term for B-field generation
use_Biermann3T: Switch to add the 3T Battery term for B-field generation
use_Hall: Switch to add the Hall term in the induction equation

hy_3Ttry_B: How to deal with component energy "work" term
hy_3Ttry_B_rad: How to deal with "work" term for radiation, i.e. for Erad, -1 means same as hy_3Ttry_B
hy_3Ttry_D: Valid Values: How to consolidate energies. Values: 0. Do not, 1. Trust Eele, discard Eion, 1.5 Trust Eele, discard Eion, 2. Trust combined Eint, recalibrate both components.
hy_3Ttry_E: How to recalibrate component energy (if D2)
hy_3Ttry_G: What to use for component P (if B1)
hy_eosModeAfter: Eos mode to apply at the end of a state advance, before Hydro returns. This is currently ONLY used with multiTemp, and ignored otherwise! Some meaningful choices are (1): == eosMode (traditional), (2): "dens_ie_sele_gather" for MODE_DENS_EI_SELE_GATHER.

useIncompNS: Should the IncompNS unit be used?

rt_dtFactor: rt_dtFactor Coefficient for RadTrans time step
useRadTrans: useRadTrans flag to indicate whether radiative transfer is in use

rt_computeDt: When true, attempt to compute a time step associated with MGD
rt_groupBarrier: Option to time group load imbalance
rt_mgdBoundEntry: How the group bounds will be input
rt_mgdBounds_1: rt_mgdBounds_1 These parameters store the group boundaries for manual entry
rt_mgdNumGroups: rt_mgdNumGroups Number of groups in the MGD calculation
rt_mgdXlBoundaryTemp: Boundary radiation temperature for MGD, in kelvin
rt_tempChangeRelTol: Tolerance for maximum relative temperature change in a cell in a time step. Currently only applied to electron temperature by ExpRelax implementation.
rt_timeGroups: Option to time individual groups (cannot be used with meshCopyCount > 1)

useRayTrace: flag indicating whether to use RayTrace unit

useTreeRay: Whether TreeRay calculations should be performed.

useConductivity: flags whether the conductivity material property is being used

useMagneticResistivity: flags whether the magnetic resistivity material property is being used

res_coef: Constant coefficient for scaling the final resistivity
res_ieTimeCoef: Constant coefficient for scaling ion/ele coupling time
res_maxRes: Valid Values: Ceiling value applied to the magnetic resistivities; use -1.0 to disable.

useMassDiffusivity: -- allows the mass diffusivity to be turned off at runtime, even if the unit is included in the simulation

useOpacity: flags whether the Opacity unit is being used at all

opacity_ignoreLowTemp: control parameter indicating if the low temperature capability should be ignored
opacity_writeOpacityInfo: control parameter indicating if detailed info of the opacity unit should be written out

op_tableEnergyTolerance: allowed difference between table/FLASH group structure
opacity_useLogTables: control parameter indicating use of logarithmic opacities

useViscosity: flags whether the viscosity material property is being used

useCool: Runtime control for turning off cooling

useDeleptonize: runtime control for turning the deleptonization on or off

ed_RungeKuttaMethod: Specifies the Runge Kutta method to be used for ray tracing.
ed_adjustBeamsTargetIntensity: Should 1D/2D beams target intensity be adjusted to mimic circular 3D beams?
ed_adjustInitialRaySpeed_1: Adjust initial ray speed when crossing domain border ? 1
ed_cellStepTolerance: The allowed cell fractional error (unit = cell edge) for a ray path step
ed_cellTimeEnergyDeposition: If true, calculates cell energy deposition based only on time spent in cell
ed_cellWallThicknessFactor: Fraction of the shortest cell edge defining the cell wall thickness
ed_computeGradNeleP: Should the phi-component of the number of electrons gradient be computed?
ed_computeGradNeleR: Should the r-component of the number of electrons gradient be computed?
ed_computeGradNeleT: Should the theta-component of the number of electrons gradient be computed?
ed_computeGradNeleX: Should the x-component of the number of electrons gradient be computed?
ed_computeGradNeleY: Should the y-component of the number of electrons gradient be computed?
ed_computeGradNeleZ: Should the z-component of the number of electrons gradient be computed?
ed_crossSectionFunctionType_1: ed_crossSectionFunctionType_1 Function type which sets the irradiance pattern for beam 1
ed_cubicInterpolationZeroDerv: Set all cubic interpolation vertex derivatives = 0 (default monotonicity)?
ed_depoReuseMaxSteps: Maximum number of time steps for which a computed energy deposition rate (stored in the ed_depoVar variable) can be reused. If 0, the rate can still be reused in the same timestep; this can make a difference when a split Driver implementation is used which calls EnergyDeposition more than once per time step. Set to -1 to completely disable reuse of depo rate.
ed_depoVarName: Name of the variable used for storing the computed deposition rate for reuse; the default is "depo". Note that "depo" can refer to either DEPO_VAR or DEPO_MSCALAR in the Flash code, depending on whether a VARIABLE or a MASS_SCALAR statement is used to declare the variable. Further note that if a VARIABLE statement is used, it can be combined with either TYPE: PER_MASS or TYPE: PER_VOLUME to get difference variants of reuse.
ed_enforcePositiveNele: Rescale the number of electrons gradient such that it is always >= 0?
ed_enforcePositiveTele: Rescale the electron temperature gradient such that it is always >= 0?
ed_gaussianCenterMajor_1: ed_gaussianCenterMajor_1 The gaussian center location along the major semiaxis for beam 1
ed_gaussianCenterMinor_1: ed_gaussianCenterMinor_1 The gaussian center location along the minor semiaxis for beam 1
ed_gaussianExponent_1: ed_gaussianExponent_1 The gaussian exponent for beam 1
ed_gaussianRadiusMajor_1: ed_gaussianRadiusMajor_1 The gaussian e-folding length along the major semiaxis for beam 1
ed_gaussianRadiusMinor_1: ed_gaussianRadiusMinor_1 The gaussian e-folding length along the minor semiaxis for beam 1
ed_gradOrder: ed_gradOrder Gradient order. 1 = no gradient, 2 = first order differencing
ed_gridDeltaSemiAxisMajor_1: The tic spacing for the major semiaxis for delta defined grids 1
ed_gridDeltaSemiAxisMinor_1: The tic spacing for the minor semiaxis for delta defined grids 1
ed_gridType_1: ed_gridType_1 The type of beam grid 1
ed_gridnAngularTics_1: The number of angular ray positions for radial type grids 1
ed_gridnRadialTics_1: The number of radial ray positions for radial type grids 1
ed_gridnSemiAxisMajorTics_1: Number of major semiaxis ray positions for rectangular type grids 1
ed_gridnSemiAxisMinorTics_1: Number of minor semiaxis ray positions for rectangular type grids 1
ed_ignoreBoundaryCondition_1: Option to ignore domain boundary conditions for beam 1
ed_irradVarName: Name of the variable used for storing the computed laser radiation field energy density; the default is "lase". Note that "lase" should refer to LASE_VAR in the Flash code, and a VARIABLE statement should be used to declare the variable. Further note that the VARIABLE statement should declare TYPE: PER_VOLUME.
ed_laser3Din2D: ed_laser3Din2D Use the 3D rays in a 2D cylindrical grid ray tracing?
ed_laser3Din2DwedgeAngle: ed_laser3Din2DwedgeAngle Wedge angle (degrees, must be < 180) for laser 3D in 2D simulations
ed_lensSemiAxisMajor_1: ed_lensSemiAxisMajor_1 Lens major elliptical semiaxis length for beam 1
ed_lensX_1: ed_lensX_1 The x coordinate of the lens for beam 1
ed_lensY_1: ed_lensY_1 The y coordinate of the lens for beam 1
ed_lensZ_1: ed_lensZ_1 The z coordinate of the lens for beam 1
ed_maxRayCount: ed_maxRayCount Maximum number of rays per processor
ed_numberOfBeams: ed_numberOfBeams Total number of laser beams
ed_numberOfPulses: ed_numberOfPulses Total number of laser pulses
ed_numberOfRays_1: ed_numberOfRays_1 The number of rays to launch per timestep for beam 1
ed_numberOfSections_1: ed_numberOfSections_1 The number of time/power pairs (sections) for laser pulse 1
ed_powerStepTolerance: The allowed power fractional error (unit = current power) for a ray path step
ed_power_1_1: ed_power_1_1 The power (W) for laser pulse 1 section 1
ed_power_1_2: ed_power_1_2 The power (W) for laser pulse 1 section 2
ed_power_1_3: ed_power_1_3 The power (W) for laser pulse 1 section 3
ed_power_1_4: ed_power_1_4 The power (W) for laser pulse 1 section 4
ed_printMain: Print details about the main laser energy depoition run?
ed_printRays: Print details about each ray initially generated?
ed_pulseNumber_1: ed_pulseNumber_1 The pulse number to use for beam 1
ed_rayDeterminism: If true, the Grid Unit will use the Sieve Algorithm to move the ray particle.
ed_rayZeroPower: Below this value (erg/s), the ray is considered to have zero power
ed_saveOutOfDomainRays: Should the rays exiting the domain be saved (for diagnostics) ?
ed_semiAxisMajorTorsionAngle_1: ed_semiAxisMajorTorsionAngle_1 Major semiaxis/{x,y,z} axis rotation angle (in degrees) for beam 1
ed_semiAxisMajorTorsionAxis_1: ed_semiAxisMajorTorsionAxis_1 {x,y,z} axis to use for rotating major semiaxis for beam1
ed_targetSemiAxisMajor_1: ed_targetSemiAxisMajor_1 Target major elliptical semiaxis length for beam 1
ed_targetSemiAxisMinor_1: ed_targetSemiAxisMinor_1 Target minor elliptical semiaxis length for beam 1
ed_targetX_1: ed_targetX_1 The x coordinate of the target for beam 1
ed_targetY_1: ed_targetY_1 The y coordinate of the target for beam 1
ed_targetZ_1: ed_targetZ_1 The z coordinate of the target for beam 1
ed_time_1_1: ed_time_1_1 The time (s)  for laser pulse 1 section 1
ed_time_1_2: ed_time_1_2 The time (s)  for laser pulse 1 section 2
ed_time_1_3: ed_time_1_3 The time (s)  for laser pulse 1 section 3
ed_time_1_4: ed_time_1_4 The time (s)  for laser pulse 1 section 4
ed_velocityStepTolerance: The allowed velocity fractional error for a ray path step
ed_wavelength_1: ed_wavelength_1 The wave length [in microns] of beam 1
threadRayTrace: Use threading when tracing the rays through each block?

ed_laserIOMaxNumberOfPositions: ed_laserIOMaxNumberOfPositions Maximum number of positions to store for each IO ray
ed_laserIOMaxNumberOfRays: ed_laserIOMaxNumberOfRays Maximum number of IO rays to write out accross each process
ed_useLaserIO: ed_useLaserIO This flag controls whether Laser IO is active

useFlame: useFlame Whether the flame should be advanced.

useHeat: runtime control for turning the heat on or off

hx_logLevel: controls the level of logging for some conditions. See Heatexchange.h for relevant HX_LOGLEVEL_* definitions.

hx_ieTimeCoef: Constant coefficient for scaling ion/ele coupling time
hx_relTol: relative tolerance for temperature errors introduced by HeatExchange. This runtime parameter affects the time step computed by Heatexchange_computeDt. Basically, if the max (abs) temperature adjustment that would be introduced in any nonzero component in any cell is less than hx_relTol, then the time step limit is relaxed. Set to a negative value to inherite the value of runtime parameter eos_tolerance.

useIonize: Whether Ionize calculations should be performed.

usePolytrope: Runtime switch for turning the polytropic eos on/off

useStir: Runtime switch for turning stirring on/off

useTurb: flags whether the Turbulence unit is being used

usePlasmaState: flags whether the PlasmaState unit is being used at all

setupConfigDirectives.comment: Peak field in gauss at capillary wall
setupConfigDirectives.name: sim_peakField

setupConfigDirectives.comment: Wall conductivity at the gas/wall interface
setupConfigDirectives.name: sim_condWall
